And the way that you think about it is refreshing to hear, to be honest, because there's a lot that people can benefit from those kind of relationships, which really segues into my next question for you. Obviously, you know, you already have a thousand clients, there's going to be people that need a Bob Wheeler in their life, maybe they're in Florida, maybe there's somewhere else. What are some of the things you think people should look for when they're shopping for an accountant or a CPA, you know, when they're trying to make that jump? What are some of the qualities you think are useful for people to keep an eye out for? Well, one of the first things I think is important to ask if I'm in real estate. I want to know if the accountants got real estate. I want to know that they've had to actually deal with real time personally, with having to deal with the limitation of the 25,000, or having to deal with a 1031 exchange, or any of those things that are real estate. If I've got a lot of stocks and I've got all kinds of passive income and K1s, I want to make sure that that's something that they're comfortable with.
